meanings.sent1: After the rain, I had to repolish my shoes to make them shiny.
meanings.sent2: She decided to repolish the silverware before the dinner party.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to repolish his wand to ensure his tricks worked smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The athlete needed to repolish his skills before the big competition.
meanings.sent5: The old car looked brand new after a good repolish.

meanings.definition: To make something shiny or smooth by polishing it again.
meanings.sent1: I had to repolish the mirror to remove the fingerprints.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler will repolish the diamond ring to restore its sparkle.
meanings.sent3: The knight had to repolish his armor for the royal parade.
meanings.sent4: She decided to repolish her nails before the special occasion.
meanings.sent5: The antique vase gleamed after a careful repolish.
